moves.5. a4: To prevent ...P-QN4, supporting the advanced BP.
moves.6... c5: A wasted pawn move. 6... QN-Q2, continuing to develop, is better.
moves.7. e4: White seizes the initiative at once with this powerful stroke.
moves.7... Nxe4: If instead 7... PxP?? Nadel has 8 PxB! PxN 9 QxQ ch KxQ 10 NxP ch, winning a Rook!
moves.8... cxd4: 8... NxN??? falls at once to 9 QxB!! P-B3 10 BxP!! PxN 11 B-B7 mate.
moves.10. Bxc4: Adding force to the attack. If the Knight captures either piece White mates on the move.
moves.11. Bb5+: Black can lose quickly or slowly. 11... N-Q2 12 BxN ch QxB 13 Q-B4 loses slowly for Black. White's advantage of a piece gives him a technically easy win.
